docs.lead_paragraph: The debate over health care in New York's race for the United States Senate has often seemed like a confusing swirl of attacks and counterattacks, with Hillary Rodham Clinton and her Republican opponent, Rick A. Lazio, accusing each other of distorting the facts. But campaign rhetoric aside, the race offers voters two candidates with sharply different philosophies on dealing with the most pressing health care issues of the day: providing coverage for the uninsured, establishing a so-called patients' bill of rights and offering affordable prescription drugs to the elderly.

headline.main: Candidates Share in Goals, But Point to Different Paths

docs.abstract: Article in series on issues in New York's race for United States Senate discusses positions of Democrat candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton and her Republican opponent, Rick A Lazio, on issue of health care (M)
